title: House subcommittee advances five satellite-related bills
summary: A House Energy and Commerce subcommittee unanimously approved five space-related bills March 8, including legislation seeking to modernize regulations for satellites in non-geostationary orbit.

title: White House proposes $27.2 billion for NASA in 2024
summary: The White House is proposing a $27.2 billion budget for NASA in fiscal year 2024 that would include increased funding for Artemis and starting work on a tug to deorbit the International Space Station.

title: Biden wants more money for the FAA after air travel disruptions
summary: The Biden administration is seeking additional funding for the Federal Aviation Administration, funds that aim to boost hiring of air traffic controllers and facilitate other improvements to manage increasingly congested airspace.

title: Biden budget seeks $27.2 billion for NASA, with increases for moon and Mars programs
summary: President Joe Biden is seeking to increase the budget for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to $27.2 billion next year, according to a proposed 2024 budget released Thursday.

title: Investing in Space: Launch jitters
summary: It hasn’t mattered who you are, or how much time you’ve spent developing your rocket: The track record for debut launches is ruthless.
